choices.C: To create job dependencies that must be completed before new job execution.
choices.A: To determine machine resource allocation among processes.
choices.B: To sort and organize tasks within a folder.
choices.D: To determine which processes should be executed first when dealing with multiple jobs.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. To determine which processes should be executed first when dealing with multiple jobs.
You can control which job has precedence over other competing jobs through the Job Priority field either when deploying the process or when configuring a job/trigger for that process.
https://docs.uipath.com/orchestrator/standalone/2023.4/user-guide/about-jobs#execution-priority

choices.D: In the RetryCurrentTransaction.xaml workflow and in the SetTransactionStatus.xaml workflow.

questions.question_text: Where is the TransactionNumber incremented in the REFramework?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I got this wrong in exam. D is wrong guys. Retry will only increment retry number not transaction number

Selected Answer: D
Answer is D Check the ReFramework.

Selected Answer: D
Answer is D.

Selected Answer: D
Answer is D guys

Selected Answer: D
D is the correct one

It's definitely D. The Transaction Number is an incremental number that increase by 1 through each transaction. Set Transaction Status if it is successful will increase the number. There may be occasions where there is a business exception or a system exception. In the config file there is a retry mechanism and this will retry the transaction item, after the retries are finished the transaction status will be set to "failed" and the transaction number will increment by 1 in the retry current transaction workflow.
D is the correct one

Selected Answer: D
Answer is D check it in RetryTransactionWorkflow. When the transaction is failed and retied then io_TansactionNumber is incremented to move to the next transaction.
Answer is D

Selected Answer: D
Checked the RE Framework, It is also present in Retry Transaction workflow

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B

Selected Answer: B
Only in the SetTransactionStatus.xaml workflow.
